Toggl Track is a time tracking applicati: Acompanhamento de alternância é um aplicativo de rastreamento de tempo que permite aos usuários rastrear suas atividades diárias em diferentes plataformas.

1. Entre na sua conta de Acompanhamento de Toggl.

  3. Encontre o **API Token** na parte inferior da página e copie-o.

Project color in hex format (e.g. #ff000: Cor do projeto em formato hexadecimal (ex. #ff0000).

Estimated hours for the project. (Premiu: Horas estimadas para o projeto. (Recurso Premium)
Hourly rate for the project. (Premium fe: Preço por hora para o projeto. (Funcionalidade Premium)
Start date of project timeframe (YYYY-MM: Data de início do período de tempo do projeto (AAAA-MM-DD).
End date of project timeframe (YYYY-MM-D: Data final do período de tempo do projeto (AAAA-MM-DD).

Whether the task is active. Use false to: Se a tarefa está ativa. Use falso para marcar como concluído.
Creator ID, if omitted, will use request: ID do Criador, se omitido, usará o ID do usuário solicitante.
O horário de início da postagem em UTC.
Duration of the time entry. Use a negati: Duração da entrada de tempo. Use um número negativo (por exemplo, -1) para iniciar um temporizador de execução.
The stop time of the entry in UTC. Can b: O tempo de parada da entrada em UTC. Pode ser omitido se ainda estiver em execução.
The project to associate the time entry: O projeto ao qual associar o horário da entrada.
Tags to associate with the time entry. Y: Etiquetas para associar com a entrada de tempo. Você pode criar novas etiquetas digitando-as.
Whether the time entry is marked as bill: Se a entrada de tempo é marcada como faturável.
Time entry creator ID. If omitted, will: ID do criador de entrada de tempo. Se omitido, usará o ID de usuário solicitante.
O nome ou e-mail do usuário a ser encontrado.
O nome do projeto a encontrar.
Return active, inactive, or both types o: Retorno ativo, inativo, ou ambos os tipos de projetos.
Get only projects assigned to the curren: Obtenha apenas projetos atribuídos ao usuário atual.
The name of the client to find (case-ins: O nome do cliente a encontrar (diferencia maiúsculas de minúsculas).
Search for time entries containing this: Procurar por entradas de tempo que contenham este texto na descrição.
Get entries from start_date (YYYY-MM-DD: Obtenha entradas do formato start_date (AAAA-MM-DD ou RFC33330).
Get entries until end_date (YYYY-MM-DD o: Obtenha entradas até o formato end_date (YYYY-MM-DD ou RFC33330).
Get entries before given date (YYYY-MM-D: Obtenha entradas antes de determinada data (formato YYYY-MM-DD ou RFC33330).
Get entries modified since this UNIX tim: Obter entradas modificadas desde este horário UNIX.
Should the response contain data for met: Deve a resposta conter dados de entidades meta.
Incluir detalhes de compartilhamento na resposta.

Fires when a workspace is created or upd: Atira quando um espaço de trabalho é criado ou atualizado (alternância suporta apenas eventos atualizados na área de trabalho).

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Client")
2. **Events**: Select **"Client created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test client to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when clients are created and will include:
- Client ID and details
- Workspace information
- Creation timestamp
- Creator information
- Client notes and status

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Client created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Project")
2. **Events**: Select **"Project created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test project to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when projects are created and will include:
- Project ID and details
- Workspace information
- Client association (if any)
- Creation timestamp
- Creator information
- Project settings (color, billable status, etc.)

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Project created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Task")
2. **Events**: Select **"Task created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test task to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when tasks are created and will include:
- Task ID and details
- Project association
- Workspace information
- Creation timestamp
- Creator information
- Task settings (estimated time, active status, etc.)

**Note:** You can filter tasks by project using the optional project filter above.

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Task created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Time Entry")
2. **Events**: Select **"Time entry created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test time entry to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when time entries are created and will include:
- Time entry ID and details
- Start/stop times and duration
- Project and task associations (if any)
- Workspace information
- Description and tags
- Creator information
- Billable status

**Note:** You can filter time entries by project and task using the optional filters above.

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Time entry created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.
